snippet: These organizations thrived in the 1980s and ’90s and were the backbone of Apple’s faithful, but for some members, the tech giant’s success has been hard to reconcile.
abstract: Mac user groups, who have long been backbone of Apple's consumer products fan base, have now been sidelined by global popularity of brand; many began in 1970s to discuss company's products and troubleshoot problems and only few hundred remain today, when tech support is widely available.
lead_paragraph: These organizations thrived in the 1980s and ’90s and were the backbone of Apple’s faithful, but for some members, the tech giant’s success has been hard to reconcile.

headline.main: Mac User Groups Fade in Number and Influence, but Devotees Press On
headline.print_headline: Mac User Groups Fade, but Loyalty Endures
